org.jetel.component

Interface RecordGenerate

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Transform
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CTLRecordGenerate, CTLRecordGenerateAdapter, DataRecordGenerate, ExtDataGenerator.NullRecordGenerator, RecordGenerateTL

    public interface RecordGenerate
extends Transform
    Interface used by all components performing some sort of generate operation - ExtRecordGenerator, Join, etc.
    For most generators, it is better to start with subclassing DataRecordGenerate class which provides default implementation for most methods prescribed by this interface.

    Order of execution/methods call

    1. setGraph()
    2. init()
    3. generate() for each output record
    4. optionally getMessage() or signal() or getSemiResult()
    5. finished()

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ALL
      the return value of the generate() method specifying that the record will be sent to all the output ports
      static int ERROR
      the return value of the generate() method specifying that the generation failed
      static int SKIP
      the return value of the generate() method specifying that the record will be skipped

    • Method Detail

      • init

        boolean init(java.util.Properties parameters,
           DataRecordMetadata[] targetMetadata)
             throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Initializes generate class/function. This method is called only once at the beginning of generate process. Any object allocation/initialization should happen here.
        Parameters:
        parameters - Global graph parameters and parameters defined specially for the component which calls this generate class
        targetMetadata - Metadata describing target data record
        Returns:
        True if OK, otherwise False
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • generate

        int generate(DataRecord[] target)
             throws TransformException
        Performs generator of target records. This method is called as one step in generate flow of records.
        Parameters:
        target - Target DataRecord
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • generateOnError

        int generateOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                  DataRecord[] target)
                    throws TransformException
        Performs generator of target records. This method is called as one step in generate flow of records. Called only if generate(DataRecord[]) throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused generate(DataRecord[]) to fail
        target - Target DataRecord
        Returns:
        RecordTransform.ALL -- send the data record(s) to all the output ports
        RecordTransform.SKIP -- skip the data record(s)
        >= 0 -- send the data record(s) to a specified output port
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • signal

        void signal(java.lang.Object signalObject)
        Method which can be used for signaling into generator that something outside happened.
        For example in aggregation component key changed.
        Parameters:
        signalObject - particular data object - depends on concrete implementation

      • getSemiResult

        java.lang.Object getSemiResult()
        Method which can be used for getting intermediate results out of generation. May or may not be implemented.
        Returns:
